metadata.title: CVE-2022-43680 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In libexpat through 2.4.9, there is a use-after free caused by overeagerdestruction of a shared DTD in XML_ExternalEntityParserCreate inout-of-memory situations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-43680` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.4.7-1ubuntu0.2
libexpat1 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu0.2').
xmlrpc-c package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
wbxml2 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
cadaver package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
matanza package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
libxmltok package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
